briefdescription.para: Success status code returned by: ADCBuf_control()

detaileddescription.para: Functions return ADCBuf_STATUS_SUCCESS if the call was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code returned by ADCBuf_control().

detaileddescription.para: ADCBuf_control() returns ADCBuf_STATUS_ERROR if the control code was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by ADCBuf_control() for undefined command codes.

detaileddescription.para: ADCBuf_control() returns ADCBuf_STATUS_UNDEFINEDCMD if the control code is not recognized by the driver implementation.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned if the function is not supported by a particular driver implementation.

detaileddescription.para: Common ADCBuf_control command code reservation offset. ADC driver implementations should offset command codes with ADCBuf_CMD_RESERVED growing positively
Common ADCBuf_control status code reservation offset. ADC driver implementations should offset status codes with ADCBuf_STATUS_RESERVED growing negatively.

When operating in ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_ONE_SHOT, calls to ADCBuf_convert() will pend on a semaphore until ADCBuf_Conversion.samplesRequestedCount samples are completed or after a duration of ADCBuf_Params.blockingTimeout.

simplesect.para: When using ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_ONE_SHOT, ADCBuf_convert() must be called from a thread context. ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_ONE_SHOT can only be used in combination with ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING.

detaileddescription.para: When operating in ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_CONTINUOUS, calls to ADCBuf_convert() will return immediately. The driver will continuously perform ADCBuf_Conversion.samplesRequestedCount samples and call the ADCBuf_Callback function when completed. The driver will automatically alternate between ADCBuf_Conversion.sampleBuffer and ADCBuf_Conversion.sampleBufferTwo. A ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_CONTINUOUS conversion can only be terminated using ADCBuf_convertCancel().

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_CONTINUOUS can only be used in combination with ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_CALLBACK.

briefdescription.para: Recurrence behavior of a ADCBuf_Conversion specified in the ADCBuf_Params.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the recurrence mode of a ADCBuf_Conversion. After a call to ADCBuf_convert(), ADCBuf_Conversion may either be done once or reoccur.

When operating in ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING, calls to ADCBuf_convert() will pend on a semaphore until ADCBuf_Conversion.samplesRequestedCount samples are completed or after a duration of ADCBuf_Params.blockingTimeout.

simplesect.para: When using ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING, ADCBuf_convert() must be called from a thread context. ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING can only be used in combination with ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_ONE_SHOT.

detaileddescription.para: When operating in ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_CALLBACK, calls to ADCBuf_convert() will return immediately. When ADCBuf_Conversion.samplesRequestedCount samples are completed, the ADCBuf_Params.callbackFxn function is called.

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_CONTINUOUS can only be used in combination with ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_CALLBACK.

briefdescription.para: Return behavior for ADCBuf_convert() specified in the ADCBuf_Params.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the return behavior for ADCBuf_convert(). A call to ADCBuf_convert() may either block or return immediately.

briefdescription.para: A handle that is returned from an ADCBuf_open() call.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* ADCBuf_Callback) (ADCBuf_Handle handle, ADCBuf_Conversion *conversion, void *completedADCBuffer, uint32_t completedChannel)
memberdef.name: ADCBuf_Callback

briefdescription.para: The definition of a callback function.

detaileddescription.para: When operating in ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_CALLBACK, the callback function is called when an ADCBuf_Conversion completes. The application is responsible for declaring a ADCBuf_Callback and providing a pointer in ADCBuf_Params.callbackFxn.

simplesect.para: The callback function is called from an interrupt context.

parameterdescription.para: ADCBuf_Handle used with the initial call to ADCBuf_convert()
Pointer to the ADCBuf_Conversion structure used with the initial call to ADCBuf_convert(). This structure also contains the custom argument specified by conversion.arg.
Pointer to a buffer containing conversion.samplesRequestedCount ADC samples.
ADCBuf channel the samples were performed on.

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADCBuf_close().

A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADCBuf_GetResolution();.

ADC driver's custom configuration structure.
Function to close an ADCBuf driver instance.

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_open() has to be called first.
In ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_CONTINUOUS, the application must call ADCBuf_convertCancel() first.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open()

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a driver instance.

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_open() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open()
A command value defined by the device specific implementation
An optional R/W (read/write) argument that is accompanied with cmd

simplesect.para: Implementation specific return codes. Negative values indicate unsuccessful operations.

parameterdescription.para: The call was successful.
The cmd value is not supported by the device specific implementation.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the ADCBuf driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function must also be called before any other ADCBuf driver APIs.

briefdescription.para: Initialize an ADCBuf_Params structure to its default values.

detaileddescription.para:
params
A pointer to ADCBuf_Params structure for initialization
Default values are:
ADCBuf_Params.returnMode = ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING,
ADCBuf_Params.blockingTimeout = 25000,
ADCBuf_Params.callbackFxn = NULL,
ADCBuf_Params.recurrenceMode = ADCBuf_RECURRENCE_MODE_ONE_SHOT,
ADCBuf_Params.samplingFrequency = 10000,
ADCBuf_Params.custom = NULL

briefdescription.para: This function opens a given ADCBuf peripheral.

parameterdescription.para: Index in the ADCBuf_Config[] array.
Pointer to an initialized ADCBuf_Params structure. If NULL, the default ADCBuf_Params values are used.

simplesect.para: An ADCBuf_Handle on success or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Starts ADCBuf conversions on one or more channels.

simplesect.para: When using ADCBuf_RETURN_MODE_BLOCKING, this must be called from a thread context.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf handle returned from ADCBuf_open()
A pointer to an array of ADCBuf_Conversion structures.

The number of channels to convert on in this call. Should be the length of the conversions array. Depending on the device, multiple simultaneous conversions may not be supported. See device specific implementation.
The conversion was successful.
The conversion failed.

briefdescription.para: Cancels all ADCBuf conversions in progress.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open()
The cancel was successful.
The cancel failed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the resolution in bits of the specified ADCBuf instance.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open().

simplesect.para: The resolution in bits of the specified ADC.
ADCBuf_open() must have been called prior.

memberdef.argsstring: (ADCBuf_Handle handle, void *sampleBuf, uint_fast16_t sampleCount, uint32_t adcChan)
memberdef.name: ADCBuf_adjustRawValues

briefdescription.para: Adjust a raw ADC output buffer. The function does the adjustment in-place.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open().
A buffer full of raw sample values.
The number of samples to adjust.
The channel the buffer was sampled on.
The operation was successful. sampleBuf contains valid values.
if an error occurred.
The function is not supported by the device specific implementation.

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_convert() must have returned a valid buffer with samples.

memberdef.argsstring: (ADCBuf_Handle handle, uint32_t adcChan, void *adjustedSampleBuffer, uint32_t outputMicroVoltBuffer[], uint_fast16_t sampleCount)
memberdef.name: ADCBuf_convertAdjustedToMicroVolts

briefdescription.para: Convert an adjusted ADC output buffer to microvolts.

parameterdescription.para: An ADCBuf_Handle returned from ADCBuf_open()
The ADC channel the samples were performed on.
A buffer full of adjusted samples.
The output buffer.
The number of samples to convert.
The operation was successful. outputMicroVoltBuffer contains valid values.
The operation failed.

simplesect.para: ADCBuf_adjustRawValues() must be called on adjustedSampleBuffer.

briefdescription.para: Analog to Digital Conversion Buffer (ADCBuf) Input Driver.

detaileddescription.para: The ADCBuf driver allows you to sample and convert analog signals at a specified frequency. The resulting samples are placed in a buffer provided by the application. The driver can either take N samples once or continuously sample by double-buffering and providing a callback to process each finished buffer.
This documentation provides a basic usage summary and a set of examples in the form of commented code fragments. Detailed descriptions of the APIs are provided in subsequent sections.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
